turns.content: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk was the founder and first President of the Republic of Turkey. He was born in 1881 in the Ottoman Empire and died in 1938. Atatürk was instrumental in modernizing and secularizing Turkey, and is remembered as a national hero for his contributions to the country. He introduced many reforms in areas such as education, law, and language, and is known for his emphasis on democracy, human rights, and gender equality. Atatürk's legacy is still celebrated in Turkey, where his birthday is a national holiday.
